title: Hong Kong students strike on first day of school
text:
It's the first day back at school today, and some students have marked the occasion by not turning up for class, as part of the ongoing pro-democracy protest movement.

These students from St. Francis’ Canossian College in Wan Chai, on Hong Kong Island, are wearing gas masks and yellow helmets -- items that are commonly worn by the city's frontline protesters.

They're also holding a banner that reads: "The five demands are all indispensable." That's referring to the movement's five demands, which include fully withdrawing the extradition bill and implementing universal suffrage in Hong Kong.

Students at St. Francis’ Canossian College in Hong Kong on September 2, 2019. AP Photo

These students are outside Queen's College in Causeway Bay, which is also on Hong Kong Island. One of them is wearing a patch over his eye, a reference to a protester who was injured during a demonstration.
description: After Hong Kong's 13th consecutive weekend of pro-democracy protests, some of the city's students are skipping class and protesting.
